summary: The concept of "nursery," categorized under social affairs, is a redirect to the preferred term "child care" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. In the context of EU policies, child care encompasses various forms of early childhood education and care services aimed at supporting families and promoting child development. The EU emphasizes the importance of accessible and high-quality child care as a fundamental social right, contributing to social inclusion and gender equality. Regulatory measures often address standards, funding, and the integration of child care services within broader social policies, ensuring that children receive adequate support during their formative years.
